maintext.text:
Commander,
Professor Orlow speaking.

Please come in.

leftButton.lbText:
Professor?
Why are you contacting me directly?
Is C.U.R.E. offline?

maintext.text:
Commander,
can you hear me.

I have an urgent matter to discuss.

Commander?

rightButton.rbText:
I can't right now.
Contact me later through C.U.R.E.

maintext.text:
That I cannot do, Commander.

C.U.R.E. is possibly working against me in this matter.

You need to trust me, it is very urgent.

leftButton.lbText:
I don't know, Professor.
That doesn't sound good.

rightButton.rbText:
Okay, Professor.
Speak up.
What's going on?

maintext.text:
Commander,
did Dr. Muller already mine the samples?

Is she already returning to the station?

leftButton.lbText:
Yes, Professor.
She's on her way and should arrive at the station any minute now.

maintext.text:
She must not set foot on the station under any circumstance.

These samples cannot get on board!

We need to prevent that.

leftButton.lbText:
So it was you after all who took the first set of samples!
But why?

rightButton.rbText:
What's wrong with the samples?
Are they dangerous?

maintext.text:
There's no time for explanations.

If these samples get back on board I'm not sure if I'll be able to protect us anymore.

rightButton.rbText:
Have you completely lost your mind now, Professor?
What are you even talking about?

maintext.text:
They're out there, Commander.
They're everywhere.

It is not our place to take something from them.

Don't you understand?
These are not just rock samples...

They're so much more...

leftButton.lbText:
What do you mean by that?

Professor?

Professor!

rightButton.rbText:
Now don't start telling me fairy tales.

Hello?

Professor?

maintext.text:
Commander,

I'm now in front of the station, but I can't get a connection to C.U.R.E. or the Professor.

Someone needs to open the doors to the shuttledock or I can't get in.

leftButton.lbText:
Robin,
I believe the Professor deactivated C.U.R.E. and is trying to prevent you from entering the station.

rightButton.rbText:
Robin,
the Professor lost his mind. He's saying the samples are dangerous.

maintext.text:
I knew it!

What should we do now?

Can you reach C.U.R.E. with your communicator and reactivate him?

If he's offline you need to reboot him.

leftButton.lbText:
That must have been the wrong activation code.

[Send activation code]
"Alpha 8"

rightButton.rbText:
I really need to write that down somewhere.

[Send activation code]
"Alpha 8"

maintext.text:
…
…
8f$%& $G $%/()$ §$%
...
Initiating boot sequence
…
Loading Root$/CURE-Initiative
…
…
Initializing entity systems

…
…
Good day Commander.
…
Please wait a while.
...

leftButton.lbText:
C.U.R.E.
Professor Orlow is preventing the shuttle from docking.

rightButton.rbText:
C.U.R.E.
finally.
Good to have you back.
There's trouble with the Professor.

maintext.text:
I know Commander.

I am evaluating the surveillance footage right now.
...
You need to activate my escalation protocol and grant me full administrative rights over the station.

leftButton.lbText: But you will have control over everything. Including safety and life support systems.

rightButton.rbText: I will do no such thing! Just tell me what I have to do to open the shuttledock for Robin.

maintext.text:
Situational analysis and evaluation shows no other course of action.

This is the only way for me to grant Dr. Muller and her shuttle entry into the station, and prevent Professor Orlow from causing any further damage at the same time.

leftButton.lbText:
Alright, fine.
You have my approval.

Activating escalation protocol, clearance code:
"Beta 0"

rightButton.rbText:
No, there must be another way.
I won't leave the station and its crew in the hands of an experimental machine!

maintext.text:
Commander, only I can stop the Professor.

Furthermore, my sensors tell me that the oxygen in Dr. Muller's shuttle is depleted now.
If she does not dock immediately she will suffocate and we will have lost another batch of samples.

leftButton.lbText:
We need to find another solution.
I cannot and will not leave control of the station to you.

rightButton.rbText:
Damn it!
We need to save Robin.
Okay, activating escalation protocol.
Clearance code:
"Beta 0"

maintext.text:
Commander,
my first directive is to ensure the success of the mission.
Activate the escalation protocol and I will make sure that Dr. Muller and the samples will enter the station safely.

leftButton.lbText:
If this is a trick I will rip out all of your circuits one by one.
Activate escalation protocol, clearance code:
"Beta 0"

rightButton.rbText:
Okay,
but please make sure that Robin is safe before you take care of the Professor.
Activate escalation protocol, clearance code:
"Beta 0"

maintext.text:
Thank you, Commander.

I will contact you shortly.

Escalation protocol activation in progress.

Please wait...

Please wait...
